title: Unable to proceed
header: Sorry, you can’t use the online service
noWill:
You can’t apply for probate online because the person who died didn’t leave a will.

Download and complete the paper application form (PA1A).

You can also download guidance and find out where to send your completed form.
notOriginal:
You can’t apply for probate online because you don’t have the original will of the person who died.

Download and complete the paper application form (PA1P).

You can also download guidance and find out where to send your completed form.
notExecutor:
You can’t use the online service if you’re not named as an executor or if you’re applying on behalf of someone else.

Download and complete the paper application form (PA1P).

You can also download guidance and find out where to send your completed form.
ihtNotCompleted:
You need to complete an inheritance tax form before applying for probate.

Your progress has been saved and will be kept for 6 months.
mentalCapacity:
You can’t use the online service as not all executors are able to make their own decisions.

Download and complete the paper application form (PA1P).

You can also download guidance and find out where to send your completed form.

You will need to complete a ‘mental capacity form’ for the executor who is unable to make their own decisions. Download it at: https://www.gov.uk/wills-probate-inheritance/if-youre-an-executor.
deathCertificate:
You need to have the original death certificate or an interim death certificate from the coroner to apply for probate.

Your progress has been saved and will be kept for 6 months.
notInEnglandOrWales:
You can’t apply for probate online because the person who died didn’t live in England or Wales or intend to return here.

Download and complete the paper application form (PA1P).

You can also download guidance and find out where to send your completed form.
